Convert Annotated Function to Tool Definition

Source: R/tool.R
as_tool.Rd

Parses annotations from a function and converts it to a generic tool definition with an args_schema field. This standardized format can be converted to provider-specific formats internally.

Annotations use roxygen2-style #' comments inside the function body (not outside like regular roxygen2 documentation). The annotation syntax follows plumber2 conventions for type specifications.

The package automatically enables source preservation when loaded. If you defined functions before loading the package, simply redefine them after loading argent.

Usage

as_tool(fn)

Arguments

fn

A function with annotations in its body comments using #' prefix. Supported tags:

  • @description: Function description

  • @param name:type* description: Parameter specification

Supported types: string, integer, number, boolean, date, date-time, and arrays using [type] syntax (e.g., [integer]).

The * suffix marks a parameter as required. If a parameter has a default value in the function signature and no * suffix, it is optional. If it has a * suffix, it overrides the default and becomes required.

Value

A list with:

  • name: Function name (character)

  • description: Function description (character)

  • args_schema: JSON Schema object with type, properties, and required fields

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Enable source preservation for interactive use
options(keep.source = TRUE)

my_fn <- function(x, y = 3L) {
    #' @description Add two numbers
    #' @param x:number* First number
    #' @param y:integer Second number (optional, has default)
    x + y
}

as_tool(my_fn)
} # }
